channel.title: How to get OLD GAMES, free and legal!
channel.description:
[center][size=20pt][b]How to get OLD GAMES, free and legal![/b][/size] by Ron[/center]
Emulators! Since I said that word 50% of you probably know what I'm talking about. Emulators are simply small programs that emulate game systems such as SNES, NES, Atari, Gameboy, and so on.
To get the games legally for free all you have to do is go to www.emureactor.info, click on Emulators on the Downloads to the left, and then just look for the game system you want to download and download an emulator from that list. Make sure to SAVE it and not open it. Some emulators aren't installed in your Program Files, it may just be a small exe file which opens up the program right away. Zsnes is my favorite! :)
Once you have chosen which emulator you want, and have downloaded/installed it, then you can look for roms. Roms are just games. I don't know why they can't just say that lol. So anyways, to download the roms from this site, I'm sorry, but you have to register with a correct E-Mail address.
Register and login to your account and click on Roms on the Downloads to the left. Then click on the game system corresponding to the emulator you downloaded. Let's say you downloaded Zsnes which is a Super Nintendo Emulator so now you just click on Super Nintendo under the Roms list and look for the game you want to download.
Search for any game you want. Once you find the game, download it, and put it in a folder on your desktop or something just to make it simple. Open up your emulator and then open up the rom inside the emulator. Normally you just go to File > Open > Find your emulator and click enter or load or whatever.
So far I have 320 SNES Games yay! Also each category of Roms has their own Top 20 games too! Enjoy this website! Remember everything on this website is free and legal. This is a RETRO rom site. Yes there are websites which have PS1, PS2, XboX, Game Cube, and other illegal emulators but you can have fun downloading those games cause they are like 1 Gigabite (1000 MB). I tried downloading Final Fantasy 7 on my PS1 emulator and it took forever! Once I fully downloaded it, it DIDN'T EVEN F***ING WORK! Grr lol.
[center]This is completely LEGAL! [url=http://www.emureactor.info/about.php]Click here[/url] and read if you're not sure![/center]
Get all [url=http://www.demonoid.com/files/details/304387/]Super Nintendo Roms[/url] - Torrent File
Well I hope you enjoyed this tutorial. Lol, happy gaming.
~Ron

might anyone know how i could zip all 35 of these files into 1 big one? and how to turn it from a ROM into an ISO because as a ROM it doesnt work with ePSXe

item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Trigun, hey thanks for telling me about that new site. It’s pretty useful! Before I just downloaded roms from torrents because all my fav rom sites have been taken over by ESA.

FastBawlz:

Nice 1 yr old bump…

Bumping does not matter in the Tutorial section. People are here to learn, not be chastised if they have a comment or question.

item.title: How to get OLD GAMES, free and legal!
item.dc:creator: @Trigun Trigun
item.description:
@Trigun wrote:

A site that has a HUGE online database of ROMs for all systems from N64 and down is dgemu.com. It requires registration, and you can only download about 10megs a day, but when you think about it, a Super Nintendo game is about .5megs at best. Also, with a lot of current PS1 emulators, it is possible to play an actual PS1 game disk from a ROM drive. I may be the only one here who doesn’t own ant PS at all, from 1-3 or a PSP, so that feature is really useful.

Read full topic

item.title: How to get OLD GAMES, free and legal!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Roms are called roms because they are “ROM Images” in the same way an ISO is a disk image. (ROM meaning Read Only Memory and traditionally referring to chip/cartridge-based storage… although technically I guess a CD Image is a ROM too.)

Read full topic
